He's just typing.
All right.

I see.

Hey Jeff.

Alex over to you, mate.
Yeah.
Well, nice to meet you guys.

So I have played a decent role.
I've been in the help desk for a minute.
Sorry, end of the day over here, been chatting away all day.

Yeah.
No worries.
You've got two people on the call.

I'm an advocate and obsessed with automation and AI and all those lovely technology things.
Jp's on the call face actually working with customers, dealing with real problems and managing it.
I've observed that perhaps there's an opportunity to streamline process, give Jp a little bit more time to do some other strategic work.
And I've… been bombarded with ads on my feeds… for months.
I don't know how the algorithm knows that, that's what we've been talking about.
And earlier in the week, we were talking to Jp, yeah, very good.
And earlier in the week, we were talking to Jp and we were investigating one.
I can't remember the name, fixer, AI.
And when we looked at it, we realized that it doesn't actually, it's great for individuals, but it's not so good for shared inboxes.
So we continued researching and you guys popped up.
We don't know anything about hiver, I know that you help us with our support inbox.
We're just at the exploratory stage of the process, we have 85 customers.
On average.
We'll get sort of 10 to 20, you know, incoming support emails ranging… from I've forgotten how to do this to the whole system's broken and the sky is falling and everything in between.
So, if of those 10 to 20 emails, automation can pick up five of them.
That's a huge saving in time and effort.
So, yeah, keen to understand how it works, how we implement it, what support options we've got all that sort of stuff we're at the beginning of the process… and.
In terms of the function today, it's all going to an outlook distribution list or a shared inbox, yep.
Yep.
It's going to support at ausfleet net and it hits that.
It… hits that address.
It's picked up by Jp or someone in Jp's team.
Sometimes myself, it's assessed as to whether it's a question and we know the answer straight away or whether it's an issue.
Then if it's an issue, it's tested.
If it's replicated, a ticket's created developer looks at it in the afternoon, something along those lines.
If it can't be replicated.
There's an email that goes back saying, hey, we can't replicate it.
Can you give us some more details?
That sort of process?
Correct me if I'm wrong, Jp, but that's the way I am.
Yep, quite labor intensive as you can imagine, right?
Particularly if it's a question because you've got to try and get your head around what are they actually asking here?
And.
Then how many people on my team are now thinking about this?
Yeah, yeah.
Exactly.
And… sense.
We're answering the same questions many times.
So it's cyclical.
You know, people forget how to add an individual into the system.
And I've seen several emails where they say, how do I add someone?
Again?
So my spidey senses tell me there's an opportunity to help… them automate that shit.
It's the same response.
Yeah.

So customers they love Jp, they love his team.
So we don't want to dilute that.
We don't want to have a robot be, we… don't want to, we don't want to make it too automated so that it's impersonal.
You don't want to feel like you're deflecting your customer base.
It's.
more of a.
One to one like needs.
To be human, yeah.
Every time's a moment to delight.

So let me kind of show you what we're working with.
So hiver is a B to B help desk platform that has a fully integrated AI solution.
We are a web based platform.
We also have an app for iPhone androids where you can manage your shared inbox as well.
But how this works is you're essentially pointing your shared inbox into one of these folders.
Instead, what this allows us to do is we'll have just general unassigned tickets from the team.

In this case, Tony stark with a billing discrepancy before I click in, we can have auto tagging with like keywords or, you know, AI tagging to be able to help, you know, bifurcate who should be answering this.
We also have auto assignments, but let's pretend we want, let's start by keeping it simple.

Then in the right hand rail, when a new ticket comes in, I could come assign it to myself or someone else on the team just to let them know that we're working on it… very similar to a classic ticketing system.
We have custom attributes on each conversation.
So, yeah.
You can select this for reporting purposes or searchability in the future.
And then we have connected apps.
So over 100 apps, whether it's you're creating like a ticket in Jira or Monday or some other platform, being… able to do that directly from here.
So that's just the quick things around the conversation.
Now, when I want to reply to Tony, what you'd expect like full template libraries?
I also have an AI assistant.
So it's kind of the best of both worlds here where it's still manual right now with the, you know, asking it to draft a reply.
It'll come and make suggestions, but the key is number four refer to relevant knowledge sources.
So I'll say one.
Sorry?
One and four, be direct.
We essentially have an internal knowledge base that you can create either internal or customer facing like this one.
This is like our customer facing one that the AI can go through or you could just upload articles.
As in PDFS and stuff.
Exactly.
So hopefully just making it a little bit faster on the reply.
Sorry, just clearing this for the next one.
Then when I'm satisfied with the response, I could come send and close or send and put in pending closing.
It is really just removing it from the active inbox of tasks that need to be done.
If they reply back, it'll reopen.
And then one of the more interesting things is we have a shared draft feature.
So you could have members of your team staging conversations and then reassigning them to a manager, someone on a technical support, et cetera.

Yeah.

say, yep.

it.
would also be too specific so that it doesn't get picked up for other things that are similar.
